intro: Barleria virgula, commonly known as the red-veined barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with contrasting veining. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Barleria virgula is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
